title: 《願榮光歸香港》嘅英文版更新咗啦！《Glory to Hong Kong》official English ver.

replies.msg:
（dgx巴official認證將會於頭幾個回覆出現）

《願榮光歸香港》嘅英文版更新咗啦！

大家有份幫手製作嘅人都完全冇幻想過會咁hit，喺大家都冇準備之下，竟然咁多香港人有共鳴，唱到有國際媒體想做訪問

有好多連登巴絲亦都好熱心咁翻譯咗英文版，可謂遍地開花，依家我哋取其褒，集大成，整咗個official嘅英文版，儘量保持原作嘅意思之餘，個詩詞meter啱旋律，而且儘量用詞唔會太艱深，希望大家以後可以學埋，一齊唱！

曲: thomas dgx yhl
廣東話詞: t, 眾連登仔
英文詞: Dr Rubbish Teen, 眾連登仔
編: t, bp, clk

We pledge: No more tears on our land,
In wrath, doubts dispell’d we make our stand.
Arise! Ye who would not be slaves again:
For Hong Kong, may Freedom reign!

Though deep is the dread that lies ahead,
Yet still, with our faith, on we tread.
Let blood rage afield! Our voice grows evermore:
For Hong Kong, may Glory reign!

Stars may fade, as darkness fills the air,
Through the mist a solitary trumpet flares:
“Now, to arms! For Freedom we fight, with all might we strike!
With valour, wisdom both, we stride!”

Break now the dawn, liberate our Hong Kong,
In common breath: Revolution of our times!
May people reign, proud and free, now and ever more,
Glory be to thee, Hong Kong!

MV （英文字幕會遲啲更新返）：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y7yRDOLCy4Y
up

一條友down down 地時播， 有振奮作用。又可以whatsapp俾d friend分享。

同一方法download mp4 都可以。

樓主個版本睇得出有參考其他post，
但係好多句意思重覆，而且停頓位唔夠一氣呵成，可改善

其他版本可以參考下:
https://lihkg.com/thread/1547782/page/1
最後果句真心唔順口

呢個幾好:
For all of our tears on our land
Do you feel the rage in our cries?
Rise up and speak up! Our voice echos
Freedom shall shine upon us
For all of fear that lingers
With faith, we shall never surrender
With blood, tears and sweat, we shall stride ahead
For this glory, liberal land
When the stars no longer guide our path
In the fog, the horn of conscience summon us
Persevere! For we are as one, with poise and be brave
Courage, wisdom, are long with us
The dawn has come. Let’s revive our Hong Kong!
Revolution of our time!For righteousness!
Democracy,n’liberty, wish them long last here
For the glory of Hong Kong

哩個真係又啱音又易記喎


何以 這土地 淚再流
Why should our tears fall on the land?
何以 令眾人 亦憤恨
Why should anger run in our band?
昂首 拒默沉 吶喊聲 響透
Arise, once again, let our voice ring out:
盼自由 歸於 這裡
Liberty will come about!

何以 這恐懼 抹不走
When fear makes its stain on our land,
何以 為信念 從沒退後
When truth calls to us, come out and stand!
何解 血在流 但邁進聲 響透
When blood flows throughout, yet still our voices stay and shout,
建自由 光輝 香港
“Free and glo-rious Hong Kong!”

在晚星 墜落 徬徨午夜
Let the stars be dark, let night be long,
迷霧裡 最遠處吹來 號 角 聲
From the mist emerges now our Bat-tle Song:
"捍自由 來齊集這裡 來全力抗對
“Soldier On! Let all come as one, let all fight as one;
勇氣 智慧 也永不滅"
Our soul and spirit never fade!”

黎明來到 要光復 這香港
Bring on the dawn: Liberate our Hong Kong!
同行兒女 為正義 時代革命
Comrade of mine: Revolution of Our Time!
祈求民主 與自由 萬世都 不朽
To freedom and lib-er-ty; forever we fight for thee!
我願榮 光歸香港
To the glor-y of Hong Kong!

《願榮光歸香港》英文歌詞 "Glory be to Thee, Hong Kong"
https://lih.kg/1547782
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區


呢個version都作得好好

《願榮光歸香港》
Glory be to thee, Hong Kong

何以 這土地 淚再流
In angst, tears are shed o’er this Land
何以 令眾人 亦憤恨
With rage, fears are crushed, in arms we stand
昂首 拒默沉 吶喊聲 響透
We rise, undefiled, our voice shall never die
盼自由 歸於 這裡
As we yearn, our freedom nighs

何以 這恐懼 抹不走
With eyes blinded, long it comes the night
何以 為信念 從沒退後
In faith, banners high, we pledge to fight
何解 血在流 但邁進聲 響透
Our flesh, sacrificed, our blood shall write this song
建自由 光輝 香港
Free this Land, “Stand with Hong Kong!”

在 晚星 墜落 徬徨 午夜
Stars will fall, and darkness fills the air
迷霧裡 最遠處 吹 來 號 角 聲
Storms will break, bedazzled by our gallant flares!
捍自由
We shall strike
來齊集這裡
This perilous night
來全力抗對
Determined to fight
勇氣 智慧 也 永不滅
With hope, with song, with dignity!

黎明來到 要光復 這香港
Glory enshrined, break our chains! Hold our lines!
同行兒女 為正義 時代革命
Freedom shall rise! Revolution of our Time!
祈求 民主 與自由 萬世都 不朽
Liberty thrives, rights divine, in our unending strides
我願 榮光 歸香港
Glory be to thee, Hong Kong!
啲詞好靚。

https://time.com/5672018/glory-to-hong-kong-protests-national-anthem/?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=socialflow&xid=time_socialflow_twitter&fbclid=IwAR2qXi7_o0upHA2eJ_kpXzJYC8U22TdaSpY85FpIHuIhR7vYghi5Vi2ZwK4

replies.msg:
Listen to the Song That Hong Kong's Youthful Protesters Are Calling Their 'National Anthem'

Hong Kong’s protestors want greater autonomy from mainland China, a grievance they’re expressing through a song some are calling their new “national anthem.”

“Glory to Hong Kong” has spread like wildfire: on a quiet Monday night, hundreds of people spread out across four floors of a suburban shopping mall to sing it. The song has been watched on YouTube nearly 800,000 times, and at least half a dozen English translations, and a Japanese iteration, have surfaced.

The composer is Thomas, a full-time musician in his mid-twenties who asked to be identified only by his first name. He says he recruited performers, as well as people to help with the mixing and arrangement, on Hong Kong’s Reddit-like forum LIHKG, after sharing a demo version last month.

“Music is a tool for unity,” he tells TIME. “I really felt like we needed a song to unite us and boost our morale.”

While he wrote the first draft of the lyrics, LIHKG users contributed suggestions in a thread that was upvoted more than a thousand times. One of them was the incorporation of “Reclaim Hong Kong, revolution of our time,” which has become one of the most commonly chanted phrases at pro-democracy protests.

“The message to listeners is that despite the unhappiness and uncertainty of our time, Hong Kong people will not surrender,” the composer says.

He adds that he wrote the song as a protest march and that listeners are free to interpret it in any way they want to — including as a “national anthem,” as many have called it. While some protestors don’t agree with the label due to its implications with the controversial idea of separatism, all believe the song reflects the trials and tribulations of the now three months-long movement.

It’s not the first song to be taken up during Hong Kong’s anti-government demonstrations. At the start of the current wave of protests, Christians and non-Christians alike would break into choruses of “Sing Hallelujah to the Lord” during peaceful gatherings and tense police stand-offs.

“Do You Hear the People Sing,” from Les Miserables, commonly sung during the 2014 Umbrella Revolution, also continues to be intoned today. Last week, students at a high school sang the Broadway tune over the Chinese national anthem, as seen in a video widely shared on social media.

But no other song has gained the traction that “Glory to Hong Kong” has.

“The song gives me a very strong sense of belonging to Hong Kong,” says Calvin, a 18-year-old protestor. ” It summarizes our hopes, our targets, our ambitions.”

A recent local survey has shown that only about a quarter of those polled identified themselves as “Chinese,” while more than half identified themselves as “Hongkongers.” The former British colony was retroceded to China in 1997, but its 7.2 million inhabitants remain culturally and linguistically distinct from mainland Chinese.

Write to Hillary Leung at hillary.leung@time.com.

replies.msg:
呢個其實唔錯㗎，但係遷就英文非常自然咁偏向iambic嘅特性，改咗原音樂嘅旋律唔少

原音樂好多句都係：
weak-STRONG STRONG-weak-STRONG STRONG-weak-STRONG
亦即：
iamb cretic cretic
有時會變：
iamb cretic iamb-iamb （多咗個輕拍）

英文好少會咁樣拍子，因為cretic自然會變「口號」，例如："Yes we can", "Save the whales", "Pass the Act", etc. 所以你覺得多短句係正常

至於英詩係咪唔會咁多短句呢，可以睇下Anglo-Saxon時期嘅作品，古英文史詩Beowulf就係每一行斬開兩本，旋律上更加多「短句」

quote.msg:
Arise! Ye who would not be slaves again

會唔會有d似 起來 不願做奴隸的人民

replies.msg:
呢個譯法其實係特登，原因有四：

一，原文意境：「昂首，拒默沉，吶喊聲響透，盼自由...」其實就係「雖然面對打壓，但仍然反抗」「脫離枷鎖」呢種情緒，世界各地幾乎首首革命歌都會有呢類歌詞，包括中共

二，原文中為何要自由：因為現時香港人冇自由，而英文中，冇freedom就係做slave

三，現時剝奪香港人自由嘅，就係中共

四，基於以上三點，有如7-1有義士於立法會寫上「是你教我們和平示威是無用的」，我專登喺英譯本寫「arise, ye who would not be slaves again」，用屬於香港嘅其中一個法定語言（英文）道出：「是你教我們不願做奴隸，是你教我們要追求自由的」
推

呢個譯法其實係特登，原因有四：

一，原文意境：「昂首，拒默沉，吶喊聲響透，盼自由...」其實就係「雖然面對打壓，但仍然反抗」「脫離枷鎖」呢種情緒，世界各地幾乎首首革命歌都會有呢類歌詞，包括中共

二，原文中為何要自由：因為現時香港人冇自由，而英文中，冇freedom就係做slave

三，現時剝奪香港人自由嘅，就係中共

四，基於以上三點，有如7-1有義士於立法會寫上「是你教我們和平示威是無用的」，我專登喺英譯本寫「arise, ye who would not be slaves again」，用屬於香港嘅其中一個法定語言（英文）道出：「是你教我們不願做奴隸，是你教我們要追求自由的」

replies.msg:
（關於太似「不願做奴隸」，見#73）

有關英文水平，我會咁樣辯駁：

廣東話版絕對係普遍香港人會用，甚至應該用嘅版本！因為對於大部分香港人嚟講，廣東話就係母語，而廣東話版嘅 ⟨願榮光歸香港⟩ 亦都會最有共鳴。

咁英文譯本其實為咩呢？有兩個：

一，母語係英文嘅香港人；
二，唔識廣東話嘅外國人。

基於呢兩個intended user/audience，個英譯本應該有以下嘅objectives：

一，意思及意境盡量接近原文嘅同時，個表達手法要係英語國家文化嘅parallel（所以有啲位冇直譯文字表面意思）
二，要啱meter，如果唔係其實唱唔到（好多翻譯巴絲其實好畀心機，但係個meter夾唔到個音樂）
三，莊重而不浮誇，原文其實係香港邁向自由嘅進程，去到最後一段嘅勝利之前都非常陰沉，有人譯咗個Glory be to thee Hong Kong其實啱meter（好難得），但係過份... 活潑？Too jubilant，唔符合原文氣氛。

反而，亦都因為呢個target audience/user，英文嘅難度唔需要過份拘謹。
推
push

《願榮光歸香港》英文歌詞 "Glory be to Thee, Hong Kong"
https://lih.kg/1547782
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區


呢個version都作得好好

《願榮光歸香港》
Glory be to thee, Hong Kong

何以 這土地 淚再流
In angst, tears are shed o’er this Land
何以 令眾人 亦憤恨
With rage, fears are crushed, in arms we stand
昂首 拒默沉 吶喊聲 響透
We rise, undefiled, our voice shall never die
盼自由 歸於 這裡
As we yearn, our freedom nighs

何以 這恐懼 抹不走
With eyes blinded, long it comes the night
何以 為信念 從沒退後
In faith, banners high, we pledge to fight
何解 血在流 但邁進聲 響透
Our flesh, sacrificed, our blood shall write this song
建自由 光輝 香港
Free this Land, “Stand with Hong Kong!”

在 晚星 墜落 徬徨 午夜
Stars will fall, and darkness fills the air
迷霧裡 最遠處 吹 來 號 角 聲
Storms will break, bedazzled by our gallant flares!
捍自由
We shall strike
來齊集這裡
This perilous night
來全力抗對
Determined to fight
勇氣 智慧 也 永不滅
With hope, with song, with dignity!

黎明來到 要光復 這香港
Glory enshrined, break our chains! Hold our lines!
同行兒女 為正義 時代革命
Freedom shall rise! Revolution of our Time!
祈求 民主 與自由 萬世都 不朽
Liberty thrives, rights divine, in our unending strides
我願 榮光 歸香港
Glory be to thee, Hong Kong!

quote.msg:
https://youtu.be/koOAJHt9UO8

Dgx巴打點睇呢個版本
樓主個版本似乎太多短句？睇落唔係咁似英詩？

呢個其實唔錯㗎，但係遷就英文非常自然咁偏向iambic嘅特性，改咗原音樂嘅旋律唔少

原音樂好多句都係：
weak-STRONG STRONG-weak-STRONG STRONG-weak-STRONG
亦即：
iamb cretic cretic
有時會變：
iamb cretic iamb-iamb （多咗個輕拍）

英文好少會咁樣拍子，因為cretic自然會變「口號」，例如："Yes we can", "Save the whales", "Pass the Act", etc. 所以你覺得多短句係正常

至於英詩係咪唔會咁多短句呢，可以睇下Anglo-Saxon時期嘅作品，古英文史詩Beowulf就係每一行斬開兩本，旋律上更加多「短句」
